how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: flash_fable
formats.instruction: Write a micro-fable: introduce a whimsical character, describe their brief adventure, and share a quirky moral. No more than 3 sentences.

formats.name: quirk_chart
formats.instruction: Present a topic as a chart: List four unusual categories, assign a description or trait to each. No explanation required.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Share unconventional, counterintuitive advice about a common problem. Explain in 2-4 sentences why the strange approach works.

formats.name: deep_echo
formats.instruction: Take a trending idea and imagine its ripple effects 10 years into the future. Write a speculative narrative, as if reporting from the future. 250-400 words.

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare your vision for the world on a specific issue in a single punchy paragraph. State convictions, challenge status quo, call for action.

formats.name: photo_story
formats.instruction: Describe an imagined photo in vivid detail, then explain the hidden story behind it. Two distinct sections, total 120-180 words.

formats.name: reverse_diary
formats.instruction: Write a diary entry from the perspective of a thing (object or concept) instead of a person. 60-100 words, capture tone and personality.

formats.name: jigsaw_journal
formats.instruction: For a topic, write four disconnected sentences—each a puzzle piece. End with a question tying them together.

formats.name: pocket_debate
formats.instruction: Write a tiny debate: state two opposing viewpoints in two lines each, then conclude with your verdict in a single sentence.

formats.name: slow_burn
formats.instruction: Take a niche obsession (hobby, idea, routine) and unpack its evolution over time. Use a narrative structure; include key moments, setbacks, small epiphanies. Minimum 300 words.

title_styles: Write your title as if it’s a line from a diary—personal and immediate.
Frame your title as a headline from a futuristic newspaper.
Make your title a question a curious child might ask.
Use a metaphor for your title to hint at the topic, but don’t reveal it outright.
Write your title like a bold protest sign—short, punchy, declarative.
structure_variants: Start with a riddle or analogy, then reveal the real topic.
Organize your post as alternating 'pros' and 'cons' sections.
Write each paragraph from a different perspective (human, object, outsider).
Present content as a fictional dialogue between two invented characters.
Use a timeline: anchor your points at 'past', 'present', and 'possibility'.
topic_angles: How everyday technology invisibly shapes our small habits.
The amusing rituals people create to navigate uncertainty.
What your neighborhood would say if it could talk.
Nostalgic moments that drove big personal change.
